main event: A civilian reported seeing an oblong reddish-orange object in the sky which drifted and then disappeared behind clouds.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes, The object was estimated to be about 30-50 miles away and moved at an estimated speed of 135-150 mph, The object's shape was described as irregular, resembling a ragged oval, The object oscillated in its movement, changing direction but generally heading from northwest to southeast, The conclusion of the investigation was that the object was a hot air balloon.
witness description: Male, 32 years old, with military experience and knowledge related to identifying unidentified flying objects.
